CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 10, 1945, pg. 15, reads: "New Library Feature - The David Light Room is one of the newest features of the Central Carnegie Library, Schenley Park, and the public - especially the younger set - agrees that a room for music lovers is a brilliant idea. In case you like to spend the afternoon with Brahms, Beethoven, or Bach, you are cordially invited to drop in and enjoy the world's best-loved compositions.  This group took time out for a movement or two during open house Monday evening, which marked the fiftieth anniversary of Carnegie Library. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Five women, including Vivian Davidson Hewitt wearing two toned dress with light colored bow at neck standing on left of record player, and man seated on right, in David Light Music Room at Carnegie Library of Pittsburgh, during fiftieth anniversary celebration, another version
